etymology.description: 四季 (all year) + 豆 (bean) = bean available year-round → green/string bean.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to the tender green pods of common beans, widely eaten in stir-fries and soups. Name highlights their availability or cultivation across the four seasons.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃清炒四季豆(我喜歡吃清炒四季豆)。
examples.english: I like to eat stir-fried green beans.

examples.chinese: 市场上(市場上)，四季都有四季豆(四季都有四季豆)。
examples.pinyin: Shìchǎng shàng, sìjì dōu yǒu sìjìdòu.
examples.english: At the market, green beans are available all year.

examples.chinese: 这些四季豆很嫩(這些四季豆很嫩)，适合做沙拉(適合做沙拉)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèxiē sìjìdòu hěn nèn, shìhé zuò shālā.
examples.english: These green beans are very tender, good for making salad.
